Apple___Apple_scab.cause: Caused by the fungus Venturia inaequalis, spreads in cool, wet conditions.
Apple___Apple_scab.cure: Use fungicides, remove infected leaves, and ensure good air circulation.

Apple___Black_rot.cause: Caused by the fungus Botryosphaeria obtusa, spreads through infected fruit and dead wood.
Apple___Black_rot.cure: Prune infected branches, remove diseased fruit, and apply fungicides.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.cause: Caused by the fungus Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae, requires both apple and juniper hosts.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.cure: Remove nearby juniper plants, apply fungicides, and prune infected areas.

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.cause: Caused by the fungus Podosphaera clandestina, thrives in humid conditions.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.cure: Apply sulfur-based fungicides, ensure proper air circulation, and remove infected leaves.

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.cause: Caused by the fungus Cercospora zeae-maydis, spreads through infected debris and humid conditions.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.cure: Use resistant varieties, practice crop rotation, and apply fungicides.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.cause: Caused by the fungus Puccinia sorghi, spreads through airborne spores.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.cure: Plant resistant hybrids, apply fungicides, and improve air circulation.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.cause: Caused by the fungus Exserohilum turcicum, spreads in cool, humid conditions.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.cure: Use resistant varieties, apply fungicides, and remove infected debris.

Grape___Black_rot.cause: Caused by the fungus Guignardia bidwellii, spreads through infected vines and humid conditions.
Grape___Black_rot.cure: Prune infected vines, remove diseased fruit, and apply fungicides.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).cause: Caused by a complex of fungi, affects grapevine wood and causes discoloration.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).cure: Prune infected vines, apply fungicides, and improve vineyard sanitation.

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.cause: Caused by the fungus Pseudocercospora vitis, spreads in warm, wet conditions.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.cure: Use copper-based fungicides, prune infected leaves, and avoid overhead watering.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).cause: Caused by the bacterium Candidatus Liberibacter spp., spread by psyllid insects.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).cure: Control psyllid populations, remove infected trees, and use disease-free planting materials.

Peach___Bacterial_spot.cause: Caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas campestris, spreads in wet conditions.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.cure: Apply copper-based sprays, remove infected leaves, and improve air circulation.

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.cause: Caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas spp., spreads through water splash and infected seeds.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.cure: Use disease-free seeds, apply copper-based sprays, and practice crop rotation.

Potato___Early_blight.cause: Caused by the fungus Alternaria solani, thrives in warm, humid conditions.
Potato___Early_blight.cure: Apply fungicides, use disease-resistant varieties, and practice crop rotation.

Potato___Late_blight.cause: Caused by the pathogen Phytophthora infestans, spreads in cool, wet conditions.
Potato___Late_blight.cure: Use fungicides, remove infected plants, and avoid overhead watering.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.cause: Caused by various fungi, spreads in warm, dry conditions.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.cure: Apply sulfur-based fungicides, ensure proper spacing, and remove infected leaves.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.cause: Caused by the fungus Diplocarpon earlianum, spreads in wet conditions.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.cure: Apply fungicides, remove infected leaves, and improve air circulation.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.cause: Caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas campestris, spreads through water splash.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.cure: Use copper-based sprays, remove infected leaves, and practice crop rotation.

Tomato___Early_blight.cause: Caused by the fungus Alternaria solani, thrives in warm, humid conditions.
Tomato___Early_blight.cure: Apply fungicides, use resistant varieties, and rotate crops.

Tomato___Late_blight.cause: Caused by the pathogen Phytophthora infestans, spreads in wet conditions.
Tomato___Late_blight.cure: Apply fungicides, remove infected plants, and improve air circulation.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.cause: Caused by the fungus Passalora fulva, spreads in humid conditions.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.cure: Apply fungicides, ensure good ventilation, and remove infected leaves.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.cause: Caused by the fungus Septoria lycopersici, spreads through splashed water.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.cure: Use fungicides, prune infected leaves, and apply mulch.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.cause: Caused by Tetranychus urticae, tiny mites that thrive in dry conditions.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.cure: Use insecticidal soaps, increase humidity, and introduce natural predators.

Tomato___Target_Spot.cause: Caused by the fungus Corynespora cassiicola, spreads in humid conditions.
Tomato___Target_Spot.cure: Apply fungicides, remove infected leaves, and practice crop rotation.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.cause: Caused by a virus spread by whiteflies.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.cure: Control whiteflies, use resistant varieties, and remove infected plants.

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.cause: Caused by a virus that spreads through contaminated tools and hands.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.cure: Disinfect tools, avoid handling plants when wet, and remove infected plants.
